intro: Christella dentata var. himalayensis, commonly known as the Himalayan Christella, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form. The plant features small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale pink, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are elliptical, leathery, and have a serrated edge, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
